lines.text: What happened was inevitable. The way it happened was unconscionable.
It's a little disconcerting to realize that the smartest member of our expedition's the dog.
Why Indians?
Oh, because I admire them. And because we owe them a tremendous debt.
How's that?
Well, they gave us romance, myths, legends. They gave us a history. The Indians shaped the character of our entire nation.
We picked a hell of a way to say thank you, didn't we?
What are you telling him?
I told him we come in a good way, in peace. I also told him you were a great warrior who wasn't afraid to fight them all single-handedly.
You've got to be kidding.
The Cheyenne admire bravery. Let's just hope they don't put you to the test.
If they do, I'm coming after you first.

[a deputy has just arrived to Lewis' house and all the deputy has done so far is call out Lewis' name]
I didn't do it. Whoever said I did is a liar.

[Getting to bed, in the middle of the woods]
Good night, Gates.
Good night, Doc.
[Small pause]
You're not gonna walk around naked in the morning, are you?
I'll try to restrain myself.
Dynamite? It's like wine, it only gets better with age.
Look, Elvis is dead, the government is not hiding UFOs, and there are no Indians in the Oxbow.
I've seen this place reduce grown men to tears. It ain't no place for a woman.
I'd say most of what I'm telling you is true. And the rest... well, the rest is the West.
I told you to watch your step! You're not in a classroom! Out here one little mistake will get you killed.
You wanna go back?
Yes. I'm an anthropologist, not Daniel Boone.

[after Tracker Lewis Gates hands her an arrow]
So, where'd you find this?
In the Oxbow.
The Oxbow. Wasn't that just in the news? Something about convicts?
Yeah, I'm the guy they hired to find them.
Bounty hunter?
Please, civil servant. It sounds a little less...
Barbaric?
You know what this is?
Well, call it a wild guess. An arrow?
A Cheyenne arrow, Dog Soldier to be exact.
Dog Soldier?
Within the Cheyenne tribe there used to be a military society made up of the strongest and bravest men. They were fierce fighters - unyielding. They called themselves Chotometnea - dogmen.
next in line to be chief.
I guess it takes a real man to shoot a dog.
You should be happy they didn't eat him. Oh, didn't I tell you? That's the other reason they're called dog soldiers.
Could you promise me something? No matter how bad it gets, no matter what happens... don't let them eat my dog.

[explaining about his wife's death]
We were riding the back country, making a river crossing. Her horse spooked, bucked her. I went in after her. Current was too strong. One second she was there, and... Her dad still blames me to this day.
What else could you have done.
Drowned.
Drunk or sober, you're still the best tracker in this state.
You always were a charmer.
Why are you being so god damn pigheaded?
Because I'm god damn good at it!
Rule number 1, Briggs, never take your eyes off a suspect.
